p: Where the first factor is the relationship between the number of different uses reported for the species (“ethnospecies” in the original work) and the total number of use-categories considered in the study (NUs divided by NC). The second factor is the relative frequency of citation of the species (previously defined). Finally, the third factor is the sum of all the UR for the species (defined at the beginning of this section), i.e., the sum of number of literature sources who mentioned each use of the species, divided by N. These three factors are then multiplied together (Fig. 2).
